chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
Zp_invertible Op

Premises:
Zp_invertible = fun x => exists i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op : Z_Zp -> Prop
Notation Op := Zp_one
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Zp_invertible_spec : forall x, Zp_invertible x < -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
Zp_mult_revert : forall x i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z_Zp) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe2
Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (l : list Z_Zp), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ 0%Z 1%Z Zeq_bool (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) get_signZ l npe
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> divides p q -> p <= q
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
div_ge_1 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, p <= n -> 1 <= div n p
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
divides_mult_inv : forall k p q : nat, k <> 0 -> divides (k * p) (k * q) -> divides p q
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (p * n) (p * m) < -> Nat.divide n m
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (n * p) (m * p) < -> Nat.divide n m
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
Zp_is_ring = {| Radd_0_l := Zp_plus_zero; Radd_comm := Zp_plus_comm; Radd_assoc := Zp_plus_assoc; Rmul_1_l := Zp_mult_one; Rmul_comm := Zp_mult_comm; Rmul_assoc := Zp_mult_assoc; Rdistr_l := fun x y z : Z_Zp => Zp_mult_plus_distr_r z x y; Rsub_def := fun x y => eq_refl; Ropp_def := Zp_minus |} : ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff...
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ divides p q
div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = div q p * p + rem q p
Nat.mul_lt_mono_neg_l : forall p n m : nat, p < 0 -> n < m < -> p * m < p * n
Nat.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : nat, 0 < p -> n < m < -> p * n < p * m
rem_erase : forall q n p r : nat, q = n * p + r -> rem q p = rem r p
Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p = Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0 <= Z.of_nat p)%Z := Nat2Z.is_nonneg p in let __arith : forall __x1 : Z, (...
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)
Nat.mul_shuffle0 : forall n m p : nat, n * m * p = n * p * m
rem_scal : forall p k a : nat, rem (k * a) p = rem (k * rem a p) p
is_gcd_1l : forall p : nat, is_gcd 1 p 1
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
bezout_generalized : forall p q : nat, {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l}}}}
Pos2Nat.inj_mul : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat (p * q) = Pos.to_nat p * Pos.to_nat q
Nat.divide_mul_r : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n p -> Nat.divide n (m * p)

```  
unfold Zp_invertible.
intros x.
unfold Op.
unfold Zp_invertible_spec.
intros Hx.
unfold is_gcd.
unfold rem.
unfold Nat.divide.
assert (Hp1 : 1 <> 0) by lia.  
pose proof (is_gcd_1l p) as Hgcd.
apply Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 with (n:=2%nat) (l:=[(exist _ 1 Hp1); x]) in Hx as Hlem.  
unfold Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 in Hlem.
rewrite Hlem.
rewrite Z.add_0_r.
apply divides_mult_inv with (k:=p) in Hx as Hdvm.
apply div_ge_1 in Hp as Hdvp.
apply Nat.lt_neq in Hp as Hpnz.
apply (div_by_p_lt p 2) in Hp as Hlt1.
split; [apply (prime_gcd p)|].
right.
unfold is_gcd in Hgcd.
apply bezout_generalized.
```

original: unfold Zp_invertible. intros x. unfold Op. unfold Zp_invertible_spec. intros Hx. unfold is_gcd. unfold rem. unfold Nat.divide. assert (Hp1 : 1 <> 0) by lia. pose proof (is_gcd_1l p) as Hgcd.
